intro: Centaurea thirkei, commonly known as the Thirke's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a distinctive central yellow disk. Centaurea thirkei is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in sunny environments.
